doc.title: Sinotruk Hong Kong Ltd
doc.source_uri: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/BofA/Sinotruk Hong Kong Ltd 1H25 in line ASP miss but GPM beat trim PO to HKD24.3 reiterate NeutralSinotruk Hong Kong Ltd 1H2_2025-08-28

processing_metadata.publication: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/BofA
processing_metadata.input_relative_path: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/BofA

passages.text: Reiterate Rating: NEUTRAL | PO: 24.30 HKD | Price: 22.00 HKD

Sinotruk reported 1H25 results and hosted an analyst briefing on 28 Aug. Revenue came in at RMB51bn, up \(4.2\%\) YoY but \(8\%\) below our estimate, due to lower- than- expected ASP (domestic ASP - \(6\%\) YoY; export - \(5\%\) YoY). GPM read \(15.1\%\) , up 0.4ppt YoY/up 0.4ppt HoH, mainly on the company's cost- saving measures, such as centralized procurement and increasing self- supply ratio. OPEX- to- sales came in at \(8.1\%\) , up slightly from \(7.9\%\) in 1H24 and higher than our estimate of \(7.9\%\) . Net profit was RMB3.4bn, up \(4\%\) YoY, in line with our estimate. In 1H25, Sinotruk sold \(68k / 69k\) units of HDT in domestic/overseas markets, up \(19\% /1\%\) YoY, vs the industry sales of \(9\% /3\%\) YoY. Sinotruk declared RMB0.68/share as interim dividend, representing \(54\%\) payout.

Sinotruk sees China HDT wholesale volume at 1mn units in 2025 (+11%) and over 1mn units in 2026/27. The trade- in subsidy for trucks should help boost replacement demand in 2H25. Management expects the penetration rate of NEV in HDT and LDT to exceed \(30\%\) from 2026, given the extending end- markets in China. For the exports market, management targets 150k units in 2025 vs 134k units in 2024. Sinotruk is positive on the export outlook in Africa & Southeast Asia. Sinotruk will also focus on the aftermarket and marketing in LatAm to expand sales and gain share, given its limited market share in the region. In the LDT segment, Sinotruk posted \(10\%\) YoY growth in 1H, and management is positive on export outlook.

As we factor in the 2Q25 results and updated assumptions on sales volume and GPM, we cut our 2025/26/27E revenue forecast by \(5\% /6\% /6\%\) but raise GPM by 0.2/0.2/0.2ppt. Net- net, we adjust the 2025/26/27E earnings by \(+0.2\% / - 5.5\% / - 4.8\%\) . We trim our PO to HKD24.3 from HKD25.4 (see details inside). We reiterate Neutral, and believe that its current share price is fair, fully reflecting its growth prospects. However, we still favor the company's long- term export expansion story and strong local market position.

Ming Hsun Lee, CFA >> Research Analyst Merrill Lynch (Hong Kong)
Yikai Liu, CFA >> Research Analyst Merrill Lynch (Hong Kong)
Summer Wang, CFA >> Research Analyst Merrill Lynch (Hong Kong)

Industrials/Multi- Industry

Company DescriptionSinotruk is the Top 1 HDT brand in China with \(27\%\) market share in 2024. Apart from HDT, the company also sells medium & light duty trucks, engines, and financial services. Currently, the company owns 3 HDT brands, including SITRAK, HOWO, and Huanghe, and 3 LDT brands, including HOWO, Haoman, and Wangpai.

We have a Neutral rating on Sinotruk as we see the company's currently valuation fully reflects the uptrend of China HDT industry in 2025- 26 and its continual exports story in developing regions such as Africa, Middle East, Southeast Asia. In 2024, Sinotruk held \(17\%\) domestic market share and \(46\%\) export market share.
Exhibit 1: Sinotruk's 1H25 results summary
Sinotruk's 1H25 earnings grew 4.5% YoY, largely in line with our estimate
Source: BofA Global Research estimates, company report
BofA GLOBAL RESEARCH
Exhibit 2: new vs old estimates
We adjust our 2025/26/27E earnings by +0.2%/-5.5%/-4.8%, respectively
BofA GLOBAL RESEARCH
Exhibit 3: Sinotruk's P&L summary We expect Sinotruk's earnings to expand by \(15\%\) in 2025
Source: BofA Global Research estimates, company data
Our PO of HKD24.3 (HKD25.4 earlier) is derived from the average of P/B and P/E valuation methodologies.

P/B methodology: We assign a target P/B of 1.4x (unchanged) to average BPS over 2025- 26E and derive a P/B- based fair value of HKD25.3 (was HKD25.1). The multiple is in line with its past five- year historical average.

P/E methodology: We assign a target P/E of 9x (unchanged) to average EPS over 2025- 26E and derive a P/E- based fair value of HKD23.3 (was HKD25.7). The target multiple is in line with its past five- year historical average.
Exhibit 4: Sinotruk's valuation summary Our new PO is HKD24.3
Valuation methodologyImplied value (HKD)Potential upsideParametersMethodology 1P/B25.31.4 xMethodology 2P/E23.39 xPO24.310.1%
Source: BofA Global Research estimates

Our PO of HKD24.3 is derived from the average of P/B and P/E valuation methodologies. We assign a target P/B of 1.4x to its the average of 2025- 26E BPS and derive a P/B- based fair value of HKD25.3. The multiple is in line with its past- 5- year historical average. We assign a target P/E of 9x to its the average of 2025- 26E EPS and derive a P/E- based fair value of HKD23.3. The target multiple is in line with its past- 5- year historical average.
Upside risks to our PO are stronger- than- expected China HDT sales and policy stimulus on the China truck industry.

Downside risks are (1) slower- than- expected downstream demand, (2) intensifying competition in the overseas market, (3) potential price hikes for raw materials and core components, (4) changes in regulations on emissions in China.
